meanings.definition: A person who deliberately avoids paying debts or financial obligations.
meanings.sent1: The deadbeat owed money to his friend but never paid him back.
meanings.sent2: The landlord had to evict the deadbeat tenant for not paying rent for months.
meanings.sent3: The deadbeat tried to skip out on the bill at the restaurant, but the waiter caught him.
meanings.sent4: She always referred to her ex-husband as a deadbeat who never contributed to their children's expenses.
meanings.sent5: The deadbeat's reputation for dodging payments spread quickly in the small town.

meanings.definition: A lazy or irresponsible person who fails to fulfill their responsibilities or obligations.
meanings.sent1: The office deadbeat never completed his tasks on time, causing delays for the whole team.
meanings.sent2: The deadbeat student never bothered to study for exams and always failed.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat was tired of the deadbeat mouse who never put up a good chase.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was such a deadbeat that he couldn't even be relied on to water the plants.
meanings.sent5: The deadbeat employee was always the last to arrive and the first to leave, avoiding work.
